text: [Music]
coming out of high school i worked about
10 years in the navy riding on ships and
supporting different operations after
that i got out and knew i wanted to get
into information technology
as i progressed i eventually decided
that i wanted to make the transition to
the cloud and then i moved over to aws
and i became a solutions architect
supporting
the department of defense in the u.s
navy
since i started my career in the navy i
still have a lot of classmates and
friends who are actively serving today
it's important to me to be able to help
our system integrator partners give them
the best technological solutions to make
their lives better
one of the biggest things for me about
joining aws was the opportunity to build
it's so rare that you get to actually be
hands-on creating new architectures and
creating new solutions
the culture is great you have a whole
team of builders who want to solve new
and interesting problems
i actually have three young children all
under the age of five
so the ability to have flexibility to
support both my wife and my family
while still supporting my customers has
been a really critical part of my role
if you love technology if you love
learning this is the company for you
